shows.title: Tabula Rasa
shows.scoring_notes: Belgian psychological thriller. Veerle Baetens stars as amnesiac woman suspected of missing man's disappearance. Nonlinear narrative reveals layers of trauma and mystery. Atmospheric and unsettling. Complete limited series with satisfying conclusion.

shows.title: For All Mankind
shows.scoring_notes: Ronald D. Moore's alternate history where Soviets beat US to moon. Space race continues with increasing stakes across decades. Immersive world-building, historical detail. Character drama sometimes uneven but ambition is unmatched. Four seasons, ongoing. Apple's hidden gem.

shows.title: Evil
shows.scoring_notes: King brothers' supernatural procedural. Katja Herbers, Mike Colter, Aasif Mandvi investigate possessions and miracles. Balances skepticism and faith brilliantly. Four seasons of increasing weirdness. Michael Emerson's villain is spectacular. Complete series, satisfying conclusion.

shows.title: What We Do in the Shadows
shows.scoring_notes: Vampire roommates in Staten Island mockumentary. Kayvan Novak, Matt Berry, Natasia Demetriou, Harvey Guillén perfect ensemble. Five seasons of supernatural absurdity. Complete series with satisfying finale. Consistently hilarious, surprisingly heartfelt.

shows.title: The Third Day
shows.scoring_notes: HBO folk horror. Jude Law and Naomie Harris in separate stories. Immersive theatrical 'Summer' and 'Winter' halves. Innovative live 'Autumn' episode. Visually stunning but narratively opaque.

shows.title: The Morning Show
shows.scoring_notes: Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoon in cutthroat morning news drama. Started with #MeToo reckoning, evolved into broader media critique. Strong ensemble including Steve Carell, Billy Crudup. S3 loses some focus but performances remain compelling. Four seasons, ongoing.

shows.title: Only Murders in the Building
shows.scoring_notes: Steve Martin, Martin Short, Selena Gomez as true crime podcasters solving murders in their NYC apartment building. Perfect chemistry between leads. Four seasons of cozy mystery with genuine heart. Witty writing, great guest stars. Ongoing but consistently delightful.

shows.title: Tales from the Loop
shows.scoring_notes: Amazon sci-fi anthology based on Simon Stålenhag art. Slow, contemplative, stunningly beautiful. Each episode standalone but connected by small town and mysterious underground machine. Less about plot, more about mood and human moments. Polarizing pacing but visually unmatched.

shows.title: Search Party
shows.scoring_notes: Alia Shawkat as narcissistic millennial searching for missing college acquaintance. Satirical mystery evolves into something much darker. Five seasons of tonal shifts executed brilliantly. Sharp writing on privilege and self-obsession. Complete series with audacious finale.

shows.title: Bordertown
shows.scoring_notes: Finnish crime series. Ville Virtanen as detective in town bordering Russia. Nordic noir with unique borderland setting. Explores human trafficking and cross-border crime. Three seasons with complete resolution. Solid procedural with atmospheric location work.

shows.title: Unforgotten
shows.scoring_notes: Nicola Walker (then Sanjeev Bhaskar) leads cold case unit. Each season excavates decades-old murder with devastating impact on suspects' present lives. Intimate character studies disguised as procedural. Five seasons of exceptional quality. Complete series with emotional farewell.

shows.title: One Day
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix romance. Strong character work, complete story.

shows.title: The Returned (Les Revenants)
shows.scoring_notes: French supernatural masterpiece. Deceased residents return to small Alpine village unchanged. Moody, atmospheric, deeply emotional. Mogwai score is haunting. Slow-burn mystery that prioritizes character over answers. Two seasons, complete story.

shows.title: Wallander
shows.scoring_notes: Kenneth Branagh as Henning Mankell's troubled Swedish detective. Bleak, atmospheric Swedish landscapes mirror Wallander's depression. Branagh's nuanced performance across four seasons. Morally complex cases. Complete series with definitive ending. Superior to other adaptations.

shows.title: River
shows.scoring_notes: Stellan Skarsgård as detective seeing dead people after partner's murder. Psychological crime with supernatural elements. Nicola Walker's presence haunts throughout. Abi Morgan's writing is character-focused and melancholic. One perfect season, complete story. Underrated gem.

shows.title: In the Flesh
shows.scoring_notes: BBC zombie drama with unique angle: Partially Deceased Syndrome sufferers reintegrate into society. Luke Newberry as Kieren Walker deals with guilt and discrimination. Two seasons exploring prejudice and redemption. CANCELED but relatively complete. Powerful allegory, memorable characters.

shows.title: The Gilded Age
shows.scoring_notes: Julian Fellowes' American Downton Abbey. 1880s New York moneyed class. Christine Baranski and Carrie Coon lead rival families. Lavish costumes and sets. HBO prestige comfort viewing.

shows.title: The Killing (US)
shows.scoring_notes: US adaptation of Danish series. Mireille Enos and Joel Kinnaman as Seattle detectives. Rain-soaked atmosphere, moody cinematography. Rosie Larsen case across two seasons, then new cases. CANCELED twice, revived twice. Watch Danish original (Forbrydelsen) for purist version.

shows.title: The Tunnel
shows.scoring_notes: Anglo-French adaptation of Bron/Broen. Stephen Dillane and Clemence Poesy as detectives from UK and France. Channel Tunnel setting creates unique cross-border dynamic. Three seasons with complete resolution. Solid but overshadowed by Swedish original and US remake.

shows.title: From
shows.scoring_notes: Harold Perrineau leads trapped town mystery. Residents can't escape, night creatures hunt them. LOST-style mystery with horror elements. Three seasons of deepening mythology. Character work strong, answers coming slowly. MGM+ sleeper hit, cult following.

shows.title: 3 Body Problem
shows.scoring_notes: GoT team sci-fi epic. Strong concept but polarizing.

shows.title: The Stranger
shows.scoring_notes: Harlan Coben adaptation. Richard Armitage's suburban life unravels by mysterious stranger. Fast-paced mystery with multiple plot threads. Some twists strain credibility but entertaining throughout. Limited series.

shows.title: Marcella
shows.scoring_notes: Anna Friel as detective with dissociative fugue investigating serial killers. Nordic noir by The Bridge creator. Friel's unhinged performance carries the show. Plot becomes increasingly convoluted across three seasons. Stylish but emotionally draining.

shows.title: Shrinking
shows.scoring_notes: Jason Segel as grieving therapist who stops holding back. Harrison Ford steals scenes as fellow therapist with Parkinson's. Warm, funny, emotionally honest. Ted Lasso creative team brings similar heart. Two seasons, ongoing. Therapy as comedy works surprisingly well.

shows.title: Abbott Elementary
shows.scoring_notes: Quinta Brunson's mockumentary about Philadelphia public school teachers. Warm, funny, socially conscious without being preachy. Sheryl Lee Ralph and Janelle James steal scenes. Four seasons, ongoing. Mockumentary format feels fresh. Network sitcom at its best.

shows.title: Little America
shows.scoring_notes: Anthology series about immigrant experiences in America. Kumail Nanjiani and Emily V. Gordon's passion project. Two seasons of heartfelt, human stories. Complete series. Authentic and moving.

shows.title: The Night Agent
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix political thriller. Gabriel Basso as FBI agent pulled into conspiracy. Fast-paced, propulsive narrative. Action sequences well-executed. Pure popcorn entertainment done well.

shows.title: Cardinal
shows.scoring_notes: Canadian crime series. Billy Campbell as troubled detective John Cardinal in frozen Northern Ontario. Atmospheric winter setting is character itself. Four seasons based on Giles Blunt novels. Methodical pacing, strong character work. Complete series with satisfying arc.

shows.title: Billions
shows.scoring_notes: Damian Lewis vs Paul Giamatti as hedge fund king vs US Attorney. Sharp dialogue on wealth and power. Seven seasons, complete. Showtime's premium soap opera. Consistently entertaining if diminishing returns.

shows.title: The New Look
shows.scoring_notes: Apple fashion drama. Dior/Chanel story.

shows.title: Requiem
shows.scoring_notes: British supernatural thriller. Lydia Wilson as cellist investigating her past. Folk horror elements in Welsh setting. Atmospheric but pacing drags. Ambiguous ending divided audiences.

shows.title: Professor T
shows.scoring_notes: Ben Miller as eccentric criminology professor assisting police. Belgian original is superior, but ITV remake finds its own charm. Miller's OCD and brilliant deductions drive the show. Three seasons. Light procedural with academic twist. Watch Belgian version for darker take.

shows.title: Mythic Quest
shows.scoring_notes: Rob McElhenney leads video game studio comedy. Always Sunny team brings similar energy but more heart. Three seasons. Industry satire with genuine character growth. Apple's most underrated comedy.

shows.title: Safe
shows.scoring_notes: Harlan Coben adaptation. Michael C. Hall as widowed surgeon searching for missing daughter. Gated community secrets. Formulaic but competently executed. Twist-heavy narrative keeps engagement.

shows.title: The Bay
shows.scoring_notes: Morven Christie as family liaison officer in Morecambe. Lancashire coastal setting adds atmosphere. Family secrets and community ties. Four seasons with cast changes. Solid procedural with emotional stakes. Not groundbreaking but reliably compelling.

shows.title: Shantaram
shows.scoring_notes: Adaptation of Gregory David Roberts' novel. Charlie Hunnam as escaped convict in 1980s Bombay. Epic scope, beautiful Mumbai locations. CANCELED after one season despite potential. Books fans divided on adaptation. Atmospheric but incomplete story.

shows.title: Stay Close
shows.scoring_notes: Harlan Coben adaptation. Cush Jumbo and James Nesbitt in intersecting mysteries. Northern England setting. Solid performances elevate familiar material. Less impactful than Coben's best.

shows.title: The Bridge (US)
shows.scoring_notes: US adaptation of Danish/Swedish Bron. Diane Kruger and Demian Bichir as detectives from El Paso and Juarez. US-Mexico border setting is compelling. Two seasons with complete arc. Watch original Bron/Broen for superior version, but this stands on its own.

shows.title: Annika
shows.scoring_notes: Nicola Walker as DI Annika Strandhed leading Marine Homicide Unit in Scotland. Breaking fourth wall direct to camera is divisive. Boat-based investigations unique. Walker's charm carries the show. Three seasons, ongoing. Light entertainment more than hard crime.

shows.title: Physical
shows.scoring_notes: Rose Byrne as 1980s San Diego housewife with eating disorder discovers aerobics. Dark comedy about body image and ambition. Three seasons, complete. Byrne's voiceover is sharp. Period detail excellent.

shows.title: Glitch
shows.scoring_notes: Australian returned-from-dead mystery. Small town police officer deals with wife and others returning. Unique outback setting. Character-driven with supernatural elements. Three seasons with complete resolution. Solid if not groundbreaking.

shows.title: Your Honor
shows.scoring_notes: Bryan Cranston as judge covering up son's hit-and-run. S1 strong with moral descent. S2 unnecessary continuation weakens impact. Watch S1 only for complete story.

shows.title: Traces
shows.scoring_notes: Molly McCarthy as forensic scientist in Dundee SIFA lab. Based on Val McDermid's characters. Technical detail on forensics is authentic. Two seasons, complete arc. Martin Compston adds presence. Solid but unexceptional procedural.

shows.title: Defending Jacob
shows.scoring_notes: Chris Evans and Michelle Dockery as parents whose son is accused of murder. Jaeden Martell excels as accused teen. Limited series based on William Landay novel. Atmospheric but pacing drags. Ambiguous ending faithful to source. Single season complete.

shows.title: Home Before Dark
shows.scoring_notes: Young girl journalist solves cold case in small town. Based on real-life journalist Hilde Lysiak. Two seasons, complete. Family-friendly mystery with genuine heart.

shows.title: City on a Hill
shows.scoring_notes: Kevin Bacon as corrupt FBI agent in 1990s Boston. Aldis Hodge as straight-laced DA partner. Three seasons of crime and corruption. Complete series. Solid but unexceptional.

shows.title: Behind Her Eyes
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix psychological thriller. Simona Brown and Eve Hewson in twisty affair/mystery. Bonkers third act twist that divides audiences. Trashy but compelling. Character psychology strains credibility but keeps you watching. Limited series.

shows.title: Truth Be Told
shows.scoring_notes: Octavia Spencer as podcaster investigating old case she may have gotten wrong. Aaron Paul as convicted murderer. S1 is strongest, later seasons decline. Three seasons total. Solid but unexceptional thriller. Apple TV+ early catalog filler.

shows.title: Crazyhead
shows.scoring_notes: British supernatural comedy. Amy and Raquel hunt demons in Bristol. Tone mixes Buffy-style humor with darker elements. CANCELED after one season on cliffhanger. Fun chemistry between leads but limited impact. Six episodes, cult following.

shows.title: Young Wallander
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix prequel to Wallander. Kristoffer Nyholm plays younger Kurt. English-language despite Swedish setting feels awkward. Origin story approach diminishes mystery. Two seasons but lacks depth of Branagh version. Watch original instead.

shows.title: Surface
shows.scoring_notes: Gugu Mbatha-Raw as woman with amnesia piecing together her past. San Francisco setting is glossy but hollow. Psychological thriller that thinks it's smarter than it is. Two seasons, ongoing. Surface-level character work despite Mbatha-Raw's efforts. Disappointing.

shows.title: Extrapolations
shows.scoring_notes: Climate change anthology with A-list cast. Meryl Streep, Kit Harington, Sienna Miller among ensemble. Well-intentioned but preachy and disjointed. Future scenarios lack urgency despite subject matter. Limited series, complete but underwhelming. Missed opportunity.

shows.title: The Changeling
shows.scoring_notes: LaKeith Stanfield as father in dark fairy tale about parenthood. Atmospheric horror with social commentary. Pacing issues but visuals striking. Ongoing.

shows.title: Let the Right One In
shows.scoring_notes: Showtime vampire series based on Swedish film. CANCELED after one season. Atmospheric but fails to capture original's magic. Watch the original film instead.

shows.title: Echo 3
shows.scoring_notes: Mark Boal (Hurt Locker) creates hostage rescue thriller. Luke Evans and Michiel Huisman as brothers-in-law saving scientist in Colombia. Action sequences are solid but characters are thin. CANCELED after one season. Watchable but forgettable military thriller.

shows.title: Resurrection
shows.scoring_notes: US adaptation of The Returned concept. Dead Missouri residents return home. Omar Epps leads. Lacks atmosphere and depth of French original. CANCELED after 2 seasons without resolution. Watch Les Revenants instead.

shows.title: Dear Edward
shows.scoring_notes: Jason Katims (Friday Night Lights) adapts Ann Napolitano novel. Young boy sole survivor of plane crash. Grief and connection stories among victim families. Tender but overly sentimental. CANCELED after one season. Connie Britton adds presence. Manipulative emotion.

shows.title: The Last Thing He Told Me
shows.scoring_notes: Jennifer Garner as woman searching for missing husband. Based on popular novel but adaptation lacks tension. Aisha Tyler and Angourie Rice add support. Limited series, complete. Thriller that forgets to thrill. Apple's weaker drama offerings.

shows.title: The I-Land
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix sci-fi misfire. Kate Bosworth in Lost-meets-Black Mirror premise. Poor writing, weak character development. Notable for how thoroughly it misses the mark. Mercifully short.
